msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Some writing on Verso
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 4171; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides; almost regularly cut at the top. Kollesis is at the middle of the papyrus. There are some lacunae and damage at the middle of col. 103 as a result of a fold, as well as in the middle of the papyrus. There is also a cut at the middle of col. 104 runs from L.16 downwards to the end of the papyrus Originally there were two fragments of papyrus has attached on the Verso, have been removed. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. In a few cases of this column the scribe separated a new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer only in a few cases. The scribe wrote some words on the verso, presumably as a draft.
